newsitem.title: ITALY: CYCLING-GOTTI THWARTS LATE TONKOV CHALLENGE.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-GOTTI THWARTS LATE TONKOV CHALLENGE.

text.p: Russian Pavel Tonkov won a duel to the line with Italian Ivan Gotti on Saturday, but lost the battle for overall supremacy in the Giro d'Italia.
Tonkov, last year's winner, trimmed Gotti's outright lead to one minute 27 seconds with his triumph on the 21st stage but is unlikely to make up the deficit on Sunday's final run into Milan.
They shadowed each other throughout the long 238 km haul from Male', covered in some seven hours 13 minutes.
Italian Wladimir Belli fought back to third depite losing control and grazing a wall on a 70 kph descent from the final mountain.
Counter-attacks on the 16 km climb left Tonkov and Gotti disputing the outcome, but after several short-lived attacks the Italian was content to guard his lead.
Barring mishaps, Gotti is a day away from giving Italy their first Giro triumph since 1991.
